title: How do people get rich in stocks when everyone invests in the same things? - Quora

response.answer_text: People can grow their wealth through stocks for an obvious reason; it isn’t a zero sum game if you do it right. In business, you are competing against others. Most start ups fail with only a few make a tone of money:  In trading, it is also a zero sum game. The Euro can’t go up against the USD, at the same time as the USD goes up against the Euro. Same with stock trading. Amazon can’t go up against Apple, at the same time as Apple goes up against Amazon. Now sure, they can both go up in USD terms, but they both can’t beat each other. And certainly Apple can’t beat the market at the same time as Apple loses to the market. In comparison, if I invest in the S&P500 or MSCI World, and buy and hold for 35 years, I will make the same percentage returns as you. Don’t get me wrong, we will make different monetary terms. Getting 6%, 8% or 10% per year is one thing; total dollar, euro or pound returns will also depend on how much we invest. But you get my point. As markets have always historically risen over time, everybody that buys and holds can make a profit. It isn't a competition like trading or business. I made more than 600% in last (2009–2019)decade in the stock market. Everyone doesn’t invest same way. Here is full proof simple method to make money in the stock market. Pick 100 good large companies or ETF like SPHD OR FDVV and invest for decades with dollar cost averaging. You do not need to learn to read fundamentals or chase higher returns. Sell only ( portion) if your profit or loss is higher than 50% in any stock. If you invest for 3 or 4 decades you will have enough money to enjoy your retirement. 99.99% your investment will be successful. This is very easy to follow if you have a good job and making reasonably good money. $100K annual income for married couple is enough to save and invest.
